name: Flickrie
body:
### Installation

    $ gem install flickrie

### Usage

Single photo:
```ruby
photo = Flickrie.get_photo_info(1337) #=> 1337 is the photo's ID
photo.title       #=> "Rock climbing"
photo.has_people? #=> true
photo.updated_at  #=> 2012-06-01 23:27:40 +0200
photo.views_count #=> 4
```

Multiple photos:
```ruby
photos = Flickrie.photos_from_set(28473, :include_sizes => true)
photo = photos.first
photo.small(320).source_url #=>
```
![painting](http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7094/7316710626_cf80b743d9_n.jpg)
```ruby
photo.medium(500).source_url #=>
```
![painting](http://farm8.staticflickr.com/7094/7316710626_cf80b743d9.jpg)

Videos:
```ruby
video = Flickrie.get_video_info(42374)
video.duration #=> 34
video.ready?   #=> true
```

Pagination:
```ruby
photos = Flickrie.photos_from_set(32445, :per_page => 20, :page => 3)
photos.per_page      #=> 20
photos.current_page  #=> 3
photos.total_pages   #=> 7
photos.total_entries #=> 140
```

Sets:
```ruby
set = Flickrie.get_set_info(23345)
set.created_at               #=> 2012-06-01 23:27:40 +0200
set.photos                   # makes an HTTP request
set.photos.first.restricted? #=> true
```

### Other Info

These are just some of the features. If you like what you see, download the gem and have fun. Be sure to visit the [GitHub page](https://github.com/janko-m/flickrie) for additional links and more examples. Waiting for your feedback :)
tagline: An object-oriented wrapper for the Flickr API.
